description.narrative: Output 3.3: A framework for an integrated Child Rights Monitoring system is endorsed by relevant authorities at national and local levels and civil society social sector indicators for children's rights are aligned with international standards.

sector.narrative: Adolescent participation data/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Data, information, and evidence in local/urban governance
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data
Technical assistance - Children in urban settings

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Kazakhstan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Drones and UNICEF)
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Ending Violence against children)
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Exchange of experience and knowledge)
UNICEF Programmes in Kazakhstan (Monitoring Child Rights)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Kazakhstan: Evaluation of PHC Impact on Infant and Child Mortality Reduction: Assessment of the Universal Progressive Home Visiting Model
2019 Kazakhstan: Joint Evaluation of National Programmes to Reduce Infant and Child Mortality in Kazakhstan
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: A framework for an integrated Child Rights Monitoring system is endorsed by relevant authorities at national and local levels and civil society; social sector indicators for children’s rights are aligned with international standards.

description.narrative: The model of the Child Wellbeing System tested in Mangystau region was documented and shared with the Committee for Child Rights Protection of the Ministry of Education for roll-out across the country. However, the national roll-out of the UNICEF-tested CWB model was not officially agreed with the Committee which has a different view on how to pursue this; new State Education Programme 2020-2025, adopted on 27 December 2019, provides a different approach for child wellbeing monitoring through introduction of a CWBM index to monitor progress in all the regions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of cities & districts certified as child-friendly

target.value: 2020:CFC assessment and certification system is automated and tested

actual.value: 2019:CFC assessment and certification system automation and testing is postponed to next year.

title.narrative: Availability of comprehensive, up-to-date and integrated data on the status of childrens rights (child wellbeing) at district and central levels, level of accessibility of data (by sex, age, and disability status)

baseline.value: Data collection systems, including the range, scope and level of disaggregation on children are not sufficient to enable effective monitoring and evaluation of the general situation on children, the a

target.value: 2020:comprehensive, up-to-date and integrated data on child wellbeing is available at district and central levels, data on the status of childrens rights is available for annual Parliamentary review

actual.value: 2019:MICS preparation stage (plan, budget, instruments development) not started since Government funding for MICS is pending approval.

title.narrative: Degree of alignment of priority* social sector indicators for Childrens Rights with international standards * Areas of priority include: Child Poverty, Child Protection and Child Care, Justice for Children, Violence against Children, Child with Disability and Mental Health

baseline.value: Indicators are not fully aligned with international standards

target.value: 2020:all priority SDG indicators related to children are nationalized

actual.value: 2019:80% of child-related SDG indicators are nationalized by the Government of Kazakhstan.

title.narrative: % of child rights monitoring funded from the national budget

baseline.value: Not available. However, 38% of MICS5 was funded from the national budget

target.value: 2020:50% of national child rights monitoring systems/ instruments is funded from the national budget

actual.value: 2019:Government funding for MICS is pending approval.

title.narrative: Availability of a costed and evaluated model for monitoring the status of Child Rights at oblast level

baseline.value: Pilot for a Child Wellbeing monitoring system is underway at oblast level

target.value: 2020:a costed and evaluated model for monitoring Child Rights at oblast level is available for scale-up
